comment: This is a page from a classical Chinese dictionary or character compendium (likely *Shuowen Jiezi* or similar), showing entries for characters related to "革" (leather). The main content consists of large seal script characters with their phonetic readings (in *fanqie* notation) and definitions. The layout includes columns of characters, each with its meaning and pronunciation. At the bottom left, the text reads "文五十九 重十一", indicating this is the 59th set of characters in the section, with 11 duplicates. The vertical margin on the left contains page numbers and possibly publisher/printer information (e.g., '陳玉').
